title: How to Sew a Pencil Case

steps.headline: Cut the fabric about 18cm (the LENGTH of your pencil case) by about 15cm (half of the WIDTH of your pencil case).
Fold the fabric in half lengthways, just enough to make a slight crease in the fabric.
steps.description: If you wish, you can measure half-way and draw a faint line.

steps.headline: Now fold the two sides lengthways to the crease.
steps.description: As you might predict, the zipper is going to be sown in the middle between the two edges touching.

steps.headline: Fold the edges slightly back, about 1 centimeter (0.4 in), to make room for the zipper.
Sew the WIDTH using a basic running stitch.
Align the zipper, FACE DOWN, in the middle where there is a small gap between the two folded edges.
Sew it on with a running stitch.Keep the zipper slightly open, enough to place your finger through.
Poke your finger in the zip and carefully zip it open.
You have your new pencil case!
steps.description: Decorate it with buttons or some cute embroidery. To seek more durability, find instructions how to sew a lining for your pencil case. This is entirely optional, but it keeps the shape of the pencil case while still giving protection to your stationery.

text: Cut the fabric about 18cm (the LENGTH of your pencil case) by about 15cm (half of the WIDTH of your pencil case).  Fold the fabric in half lengthways, just enough to make a slight crease in the fabric. If you wish, you can measure half-way and draw a faint line. Unfold it.  Now fold the two sides lengthways to the crease. As you might predict, the zipper is going to be sown in the middle between the two edges touching. Fold the edges slightly back, about 1 centimeter (0.4 in), to make room for the zipper.  Sew the WIDTH using a basic running stitch.  Align the zipper, FACE DOWN, in the middle where there is a small gap between the two folded edges.  Sew it on with a running stitch.Keep the zipper slightly open, enough to place your finger through.  Poke your finger in the zip and carefully zip it open.  Turn out.  You have your new pencil case! Decorate it with buttons or some cute embroidery. To seek more durability, find instructions how to sew a lining for your pencil case. This is entirely optional, but it keeps the shape of the pencil case while still giving protection to your stationery. Finished.
